text:
In Fortnite, you can send
in-game items to your friends

by using the gifting feature
of the Fortnite item shop.

You can send skins, back
blings, harvesting tools,
gliders, contrails, emotes, wraps, music,
and loading screens.

In this video, we will
gift a skin to a friend.

To gift an item, open
the Fortnite item shop
and find the cosmetic item
that you'd like to send to a friend.

We are going to choose
this Recon Ranger skin.
In the top right of the screen,

make sure you have enough
V-bucks to purchase the item.

Select the item and choose
the option "BUY AS A GIFT."
In the scrollable menu,

you can choose a player
on your friends list
to receive the item.

To find them faster, you
can type in their username.

If your friend already has the
item you're trying to send,
a prompt will appear to let you know,

and you will not be able
to send the item as a gift.
If you're having trouble gifting an item,

make sure to read the
Fortnite gifting policy.
In order to send a gift,

you'll have to enable
multifactor authentication
on your account,
and the person receiving the gift

has to be on your friends
list for at least two days
before sending them a gift.

Once you've met the
requirements for gifting,

you can personalize the gift
by selecting wrap options.

This will let you change the
color of the gift wrapping,
and in the past,

it allowed you to send
a customized message.

When you choose a friend
and select "PURCHASE GIFT,"

the player will receive
the item immediately.

The next time they enter
the Fortnite lobby,

they will see a prompt appear
with a gift-wrapped item
and a friendly message.
The item is now in their inventory,
and they'll be able to use it in game.

Check out the Fortnite
playlist on our page
for more game tips.
